author: nhcwebmaster@noaa.gov (NHC Webmaster)
nhc_headline: ...FLASH FLOODING REMAINS A THREAT AS RAINBANDS FROM CHANTAL MOVE INLAND ACROSS NORTHEASTERN SOUTH CAROLINA AND EASTERN NORTH CAROLINA...
summary: ...FLASH FLOODING REMAINS A THREAT AS RAINBANDS FROM CHANTAL MOVE INLAND ACROSS NORTHEASTERN SOUTH CAROLINA AND EASTERN NORTH CAROLINA... As of 8:00 AM EDT Sun Jul 06 the center of Chantal was located near 34.0, -79.2 with movement NNW at 8 mph. The minimum central pressure was 1005 mb with maximum sustained winds of about 40 mph.

summary_detail.value: ...FLASH FLOODING REMAINS A THREAT AS RAINBANDS FROM CHANTAL MOVE INLAND ACROSS NORTHEASTERN SOUTH CAROLINA AND EASTERN NORTH CAROLINA... As of 8:00 AM EDT Sun Jul 06 the center of Chantal was located near 34.0, -79.2 with movement NNW at 8 mph. The minimum central pressure was 1005 mb with maximum sustained winds of about 40 mph.

title: Summary - Tropical Storm Chantal (AT3/AL032025)
